body: Hi @auesro please put the output of version in the issue; for long term records of issues "latest" isn't great for us :). Does this happen outside of COLAB? Can you tell me more about your COLAB env, do you have a pro account that doesn't have the low RAM cap?

Hi @MMathisLab 
Sorry, I just added the DLC version. It is actually the one COLAB currently uses (2.2.1).
I did not test outside COLAB, for the lack of a proper GPU. However, it started happening recently (last week) since I have been analyzing videos before without this issue.

Hi @auesro, I've run a video analysis for multiple hours on COLAB (the free version) with `use_shelve=True` and have had stable system & GPU RAM usage all along; RAM usage does increase slowly if not using shelve though. I'm not sure about what may be happening in your case. ðŸ˜•

Hi @jeylau , I just ran both with use_shelve=False and True. Attached you can see the progression of RAM use. I took the screenshot a couple of seconds before the runtime restarts by itself when it runs out of memory:
`use_shelve=False`:
![Screenshot from 2022-05-03 14-21-36_shelveFalse](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24290290/166453871-f0bc3b49-c762-4e2b-a802-7cf9abb7cdcc.png)

`use_shelve=True`:
![Screenshot from 2022-05-03 14-31-49_shelveTrue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24290290/166453922-e5b20d17-efbe-44b2-bee2-c4ff141767a1.png)

I am happy to share with you the model, mp4 and h5 files if you might consider it useful.

Thanks!
does this happen with `robust_nframes=False`? and do you need this to be set to true otherwise?

It does. Actually, those videos are already analyzed (as you can read in the cell output) but with auto_track=False. Now we just want to get the tracks (remember our previous issue #1789 ), hence I believe the problem is either in `convert_detections2tracklets` or in `stitch_tracklets`...
`robust_nframes=False` and `use_shelve=True` :
![Screenshot from 2022-05-03 15-06-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24290290/166459354-786e55e9-44b7-41cf-a3ec-1c4d072e9ecf.png)

right, so indeed this is not in analyze_videos at all :) -- so now that makes sense. In short, no memory leak in analyze_videos :) as the videos were analyzed, it's only the `convert_detections2tracklets` and/or in `stitch_tracklets`
could you try running each step, convert_detections2tracklets or in stitch_tracklets, separately to profile which seems to be the cause?
You are right, I should have phrased the issue correctly, sorry!

The issue appears already with `convert_detections2tracklets` :
![Screenshot from 2022-05-03 16-09-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24290290/166469904-670b524b-4d5c-4c70-b1fd-84536349ce74.png)

issue.title: Add option to write assemblies to disk on the fly

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Long videos appear to incur large RAM usage in order to store all animal assemblies.
Similar to #1468, assemblies can now be dumped to disk on the fly with `use_shelve=True` in `convert_detections2tracklets`, or, for advanced users, at a lower level by specifying `shelf_path` in the `Assembler`.

- [x] shelved assemblies
- [ ] shelved tracklets
- [ ] make Stitcher handle NestedShelf

Fixes #1804

body: @auesro, I came up with a solution in #1820. `use_shelve` will now also affects the behavior of `convert_detections2tracklets`, which should result in very low memory usage! ðŸ˜ƒ

Hi @jeylau, that sounds great. Let me know when its available for COLAB use!
Thanks!
